result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marques Javontae Holt

defendant.name: Holt, Marques Javontae
defendant.address: 5613 West Morgan Avenue Unit B, Milwaukee, WI 53220

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marques J Holt appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude appeared by video for Marques J Holt.  Prosecuting Attorney Careen Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Shull. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marques J Holt not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude appeared by video for Marques J Holt.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status of counsel. Defense newly appointed. Court finds good cause for prelim time limits for the representation. Case set for prelim in prelim court. Case adjourned in Prelim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Marques J. Holt, House of Correction - K6/Bed 7, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Dismissal.  (Marques J. Holt, House of Correction - K6/Bed 7, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Marques J Holt not in court.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. PD's office appearance by Attorney Thomas Reed. Case in court for State vs. Lee. Atty Reed advises of efforts. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for appointment of counsel for prelim. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Marques J. Holt - #2022007371, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Marques J Holt not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marques J Holt not in court, defendant in custody.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marques J Holt not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present.  OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Bryce A.H.; Makeba L.W.; Yvette A.W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marques J Holt in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Marques J Holt in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marques J Holt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Court orally amends "use of dangerous weapon" enhancer.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
